Title: Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops
RoleDescription:
Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops - Wayfair Branded Stores
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation starts at $21.00/hour for this role.
Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a critical role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Leveraging data-driven insights and problem-solving expertise, youll implement best practices that improve product availability, minimize discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that enhance store performance. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment, and has a strong background in inventory management and logistics, and is passionate about building scalable solutions that drive retail success.
What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

Demonstrate Reliability & Professionalism: Maintain strong attendance and communication to support business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control initiatives to ensure accurate stock levels, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies accordingly.
Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and refine logistics processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve fulfillment speed. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and overall supply chain coordination.
Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring accurate receiving, processing, and dispatch. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment discrepancies and improve delivery timelines.
Drive Operational Excellence & Compliance: Monitor adherence to inventory and logistics policies, conduct regular audits, and implement corrective actions to maintain high operational standards.
Mentor & Develop Logistics Team Members: Train and support Logistics & Inventory Specialists, providing guidance on best practices, troubleshooting challenges, and fostering a high-performance culture.
Analyze Performance & Drive Data-Driven Decisions: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory, shipping, and logistics. Leverage insights to identify areas for improvement and make informed recommendations.
Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics processes with broader business objectives. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer experience.
Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify operational bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to enhance workflow, accuracy, and efficiency in logistics operations.
Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by staying agile, managing shifting priorities, and proactively addressing challenges as they arise.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field preferred, or equivalent work experience.
Experience: 3-5 years of experience in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, preferably in a retail environment. Experience leading projects, mentoring team members, and driving operational improvements.
Inventory & Logistics Expertise: Strong understanding of inventory management principles, logistics workflows, and best practices for stock accuracy and shipment processing. Experience with WMS systems and inventory tracking technology is a plus.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop effective solutions to improve efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness.
Leadership & Collaboration: Proven ability to mentor, train, and develop team members while working cross-functionally with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Familiarity with inventory management systems, order management tools, and scan technology preferred.
Physical Requirements: Ability to perform frequent movement, including standing, kneeling, crouching, and repetitive motions. Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs as needed.
Availability: Open schedule availability, including nights, weekends, and holidays, is required.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

Title: Global Safety & Security Intelligence Specialist
RoleDescription:
This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.
We are Wayfair. We deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for a talented GSOC analyst to join our newly formed Global Corporate Security Team. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company and to help build a department from the ground up  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
The GSOC analyst will be responsible for the daily operations of the GSOC and providing support to applicable stakeholders in the event of an incident or crisis.  This individual will be part of a dynamic corporate security team whose mission is to provide world class support to our partners. This person will work on building and expanding the GSOC to 24/7 operations in the future and supporting the Corporate Security Team at Wayfair. This person will report to the GSOC Supervisor.

Perform daily functions of the GSOC by monitoring alarms, access control, CCTV, and key events that may impact Wayfairs operations and assets, providing periodic and timely reports.

Conduct open-source intelligence (OSINT) collection and analysis to support situational awareness, incident response, and threat assessments.
Draft and refine briefing documents and situational reports, incorporating feedback to ensure clarity, actionability, and strategic relevance.
Evaluate and improve the structure and impact of internal reporting products to align with leadership needs.
Dispatch and coordinate responses to incidents or crisis events that occur or could potentially impact Wayfairs operations.
Maintain detailed records of communications and events, including incident tracking and case management.
Manage and handle sensitive incidents while maintaining confidentiality.
Collaborate with global partners to identify security risks and develop mitigation strategies.

What Youll Need

2+ years of experience working in a security function, preferably in an operations or control center setting (either government or private sector).
Bachelors Degree preferred.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced work environment, think through problems, and make sound decisions under pressure.
Must have the ability to communicate both written and orally with applicable stakeholders and represent Wayfair to external parties such as law enforcement.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Strong decision-making ability during both crisis and non-crisis situations.
Ability to work in a flexible scheduling environment and support 24/7 operation as needed.

Title: Community Marketing Senior Associate
RoleDescription:
This is a full-time (40 hours/week) salaried role based in Wilmette, IL. The position requires in office presence Monday through Friday, with flexibility to accommodate in-store or off-site events as needed.
The salary range for this position is $79,325 - $87,875, however base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Role Description:
The Physical Retail team at Wayfair is responsible for creating and executing a robust playbook to drive traffic to our expanding retail footprint, and enable the omnichannel shopping experience for customers.
The Wayfair Physical Retail Marketing team is looking for a Community Marketing Senior Associate to drive the community marketing and activation strategy for our first large-format Wayfair store in Wilmette, IL. This individual will lead the development and execution of a community engagement strategy that acquires new customers and drives traffic to the store. This will be achieved through strategies that include in-store and local programming, community partnerships, and digital amplification via social media and other outlets.  
The Senior Marketing Associate will be based out of the Chicago-area, but report to the Home Office Physical Retail Marketing team in Boston. They will also partner cross functionally with other members of the field team and work regularly with other Home Office teams to drive the community strategy and deliver results against it.  The ideal candidate thrives in an entrepreneurial environment and is energized by creating (and executing) new strategies and initiatives. They are both creative and analytical with a passion for serving the customer, connecting with the community, and being part of a high-performing team. 
Core Responsibilities 

Community Marketing Strategy 

Partner with Home Office to develop and deliver community marketing roadmap, playbook, seasonal strategies, and execution  
Proactively identify, vet, and recommend local opportunities that drive our business and objectives forward, including forecasting and analyzing its impact
Develop and execute local social media strategy and content calendar in partnership with Home Office channel leads
Analyze and recap activities, inclusive of results, learnings, strategic recommendations, customer feedback, etc.

In-Store Programming

Partner with Home Office and local field management to develop an in-store event calendar that balances the brands go-to-market priorities with local community priorities and nuances. Initially targeting 1-2 in-store events/month with room to grow.
Provide on-location support to execute in-store events, property activations, installations, and ad hoc opportunities

Community Engagement  

Identify and develop relationships with key community partners to generate awareness of Wayfairs new store and suite of products. Partner with Home Office to build community engagement calendar of events
Source and strategically participate in local events to build Wayfairs presence within the  community
Plan and execute community outreach to drive awareness of key promotions and initiatives
Support local hiring initiatives on an ad hoc basis 
Support community outreach efforts

Always On Activities 

Partner with Home Office Marketing and Creative teams to manage the stores Instagram account, including capturing and posting content 
Manage the stores local online presence including Google, Yelp, Bing listings (photos, hours), and website pages (photos, hours, event calendar)
Budget management, reporting, and forecasting
Inventory management of in-store marketing materials (marketing kit, swag, handouts, catalog inventory, printed coupons)
Support new store openings as they occur
Ad hoc projects and store support as required


Qualifications:
Required

Demonstrated success developing and executing community marketing strategies, including forecasting impact/costs, manipulating data to analyze results, and making strategic recommendations
Ability to drive results and effectively collaborate within a matrixed environment 
Superb project and time management skills, including the ability to work on multiple projects at once with a variety of partners and stakeholders
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence cross-functional stakeholders - Effective presentation skills are a must (both developing materials and presenting them, e.g. recap decks)
Connection to local community and a pulse on whats relevant for our customer demographic
Excellent communication skills and comfort with media appearances, representing the brand, contacting community leaders, hosting events, etc.
Schedule flexibility to attend on-site activations outside of core working hours as needed 
Ability to transport and set-up materials that support community activations, e.g. tabling presentations
Budget management and forecasting

Working knowledge of retail math (e.g. traffic, conversion, UPT, AOV, etc.) and customer marketing metrics (e.g. customer acquisition, retention, frequency, etc.)

Title: Senior Software Engineering Manager, Supply Chain Retail Tech
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 What Youll Do:

Play a key role in developing and driving a multi-year technology strategy for a complex platform. 
Lead multiple software development teams - architecting solutions at scale to empower the business and owning all aspects of the SDLC: design, build, deliver, and maintain.
Directly and indirectly manage several software engineers by providing coaching, guidance, and mentorship to grow the team as well as individuals.
Inspire, coach, mentor, and support your team members in their day to day work and their long term professional growth.
Attract, onboard, develop and retain diverse top talents, while fostering an inclusive and collaborative team and culture (our latest DEI Report)
Lead your team and peers by example. As a senior member of the team your methodologies, technical and operational excellence practices, and system designs will help to continuously improve our domain.
Identify, propose, and drive initiatives to advance the technical skills, standards, practices, architecture, and documentation of our engineering teams.
Facilitate technical debate and decision making with an appreciation for trade-offs
Continuously rethink and push the status quo, even when it challenges your/our established  ideas.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

Results-oriented, collaborative, pragmatic, and continuous improvement mindset
Hands-on experience driving release engineering within high-growth environments, previous platform experience is required.
Good understanding of modern deployment methodologies including progressive, green/blue, etc.
Experience working with containers, container orchestration and deploy automation
12+ years of experience in engineering, out of which at least 3-6 years spent in leadinghighly performant teams .
Experience making architectural and design-related decisions for large scale platforms,understanding the tradeoffs between time-to-market vs. flexibility.
Significant experience and vocation in managing and enabling peoples growth and performance. 
Experience designing and building high-scale generalizable products with outstanding user experience. Practical experience in hiring and developing engineering teams and culture and leading interdisciplinary teams in a fast-paced agile environment.
Capability to communicate and collaborate across the wider organization, influencing decisions with and without direct authority and always with inclusive, adaptable, and persuasive communication.
Analytical and decision-making skills that integrate technical and business requirements

Title: Marketing Merchandising
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate, Marketing Merchandising to join our UK Marketing Merchandising team. This team is responsible for shaping a best-in-class merchandising experience by strategically selecting and presenting products that align with market trends, customer preferences, and business objectives across multiple channels - including TV, onsite, social media, email, and out-of-home (OOH) marketing.
As an Associate, Marketing Merchandising, you will support the development and execution of assortment and merchandising strategies for key promotional and brand campaigns. You will work cross-functionally to ensure seamless execution, leveraging data insights to curate high-impact product selections that enhance customer engagement and drive business performance. This role requires a creative eye, strong analytical skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
What Youll Do
Assortment Strategy & Execution

Develop and execute curated product assortments for key promotional and brand campaigns within project timelines
Align merchandising initiatives with business priorities, customer preferences, and seasonal trends.
Address tactical and operational challenges to ensure seamless merchandising execution.
Collaborate with Category Management and Pricing teams to integrate sales insights, optimize product selections, and identify growth opportunities.

Performance Analysis & Optimization

Analyze campaign and product performance to generate insights, refine strategies, and enhance future curated assortments.
Ensure quality assurance for all merchandise assets, maintaining accuracy and recommending improvements as needed.
Conduct post-campaign reviews to identify key learnings and drive continuous improvement.

Market Research & Trend Forecasting

Monitor consumer trends, competitive activity, and industry shifts to refine Wayfairs merchandising strategy.
Utilize data-driven insights to enhance curation tactics and optimize category performance.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Merchandising Initiatives

Assist in developing and executing curated events and cross-functional merchandising initiatives, including event tracking, content management, merchandising curation, and New In strategy.
Collaborate with Marketing, Brand, Creative, Promotions, and Category Management teams to refine Wayfairs merchandising approach.
Ensure merchandising strategies align with business objectives, seasonal trends, and customer insights.

Process Improvement & Operational Efficiency

Optimize merchandising workflows to enhance efficiency and streamline operations.
Implement best practices to improve the speed, accuracy, and effectiveness of marketing merchandising.
Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure seamless collaboration and stakeholder alignment.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in Marketing, Advertising, Brand, Business, Economics, or a related field, with 1.5-3 years of experience in buying / merchandising, e-commerce, or retail.
Ability to translate brand vision, customer insights, and financial objectives into effective product assortments and seamless execution.
Data-driven mindset, with expertise in analyzing large data sets and deriving actionable insights.
Strong aesthetic sense and trend awareness to drive high-quality product curation.
Passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Proven project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, fostering strong cross-functional partnerships.
Proficiency in Excel, Looker, Google BigQuery (GBQ), or similar performance tracking tools is a plus.
Fluency in English

Why Join Us?
This role offers the opportunity to be at the intersection of creative curation and data-driven decision-making. You will play an integral role in shaping Wayfairs promotional and brand merchandising strategy, ensuring our product selections resonate with customers and drive business impact.
If you are passionate about merchandising, analytical problem-solving, and delivering an exceptional customer experience, wed love to hear from you!

Title: Machine Learning Scientist -  Catalog Science Foundations
RoleDescription:
The Catalog Science Foundations team at Wayfair drives growth by tackling fundamental challenges ranging from multi-modal product understanding, product relationships modeling, to GenAI-driven catalog intelligence at scale. Our team provides the core capabilities that are crucial for enhancing the customer browse experience (e.g., visual search, recommendations), streamlining supplier product onboarding (e.g., product classification, image and content tagging), informing catalog competitiveness, and ultimately delivering significant impact for our customers, suppliers, and Wayfair.
We are looking for a strong Machine Learning Scientist with deep technical expertise and a proactive, action-oriented mindset. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and refining the advanced models and systems that power our core mission. You will contribute to a diverse range of initiatives by applying cutting-edge deep learning techniques, vision-language models, and Generative AI agentic workflows. You will work in close collaboration with a highly capable, cross-functional team to tackle complex, high-impact challenges and help pioneer innovative solutions.
If you are passionate about working on cutting-edge AI problems, building scalable machine learning systems that solve real-world challenges, and directly contributing to significant business impact, this is the role for you.
What youll do:

Research and experiment with state-of-the-art multi-modal understanding techniques and algorithms. Design and implement evaluation strategies applied to real-world scenarios tailored to Wayfair use cases.
Leverage and fine-tune LLMs (e.g., OpenAI GPT, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, Open Source) to build AI-driven classifiers, product taggers, and quality control mechanisms.
Develop and refine the visual search system leveraging cutting edge technologies in computer vision, vision language models, and the large scale data orchestration.
Implement AI-powered automation for product data structuring, attribute extraction, and metadata validationensuring our catalog remains accurate, complete, and scalable.
Collaborate with top AI research and industry leaders (e.g., Google, Anthropic, Snorkel AI) to explore cutting-edge techniques in LLMs, data labeling automation, and scalable ML workflows.
Develop agentic AI workflows for automated schema definition, dataset generation, production relationship modeling, and LLM-based judgment systems to validate catalog data.
Partner with cross-functional teams across engineering, scientists, and product to ensure AI solutions integrate seamlessly into catalog systems.
Optimize cost, efficiency, and scalability of AI models, leveraging parameter-efficient fine-tuning (LoRA, QLoRA), knowledge distillation, and hybrid ML approaches.

Who you are:

PhD with 0-1+ years of experience or Masters in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field with 2+ years of full-time industry experience in applied research.
Proven track record of delivering successful machine learning projects from conception to production, demonstrating strong deployment, problem-solving, and maintenance skills.
Deep understanding of both traditional Machine learning approaches and deep learning techniques, reinforcement learning, and multi-modal understanding. 
Deep understanding of LLMs, generative AI, and fine-tuning techniques, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques,  with hands-on experience using models like GPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.
Deep understanding of data engineering concepts with experience in building scalable data pipelines for collecting, processing, and transforming data.
Professional coding expertise in languages like Python and Go, proficiency in SQL, and experience with data visualization tools; skilled in using ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch) and implementing CI/CD, containerization, and version control best practices.
Familiarity with ML Ops, cloud infrastructure, and engineering best practices (Airflow, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Kubernetes, Spark, Python, SQL).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders while collaborating across teams.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new tools and techniques in a fast-paced, evolving environment, while managing multiple priorities with a high level of attention to detail and staying current with the latest ML research.

Nice to have:

Research publications in deep learning, computer vision, or generative AI.
Experience working in e-commerce catalog AI systems, retail data structuring, or large-scale product classification.

You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Graduate Assistant Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company

Title: Manager, Procurement Operations
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. This highly visible role is pivotal to standardizing our firm-wide buying process, improving our downstream financial operations, tracking spend data, unlocking process efficiencies, and maximizing our teams return on investment. We are looking for adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, questioning inefficiencies, using data to solve problems, and multi-tasking. 
As the lead Product Manager, you will need to understand the needs of cross-functional partners across finance, accounting, engineering, and the business - then translate them into a product strategy and roadmap for our suite of Procurement tools, including Coupa, Contract Lifecycle Management, and Vendor Management System. As the internal expert and guru of our procure-to-pay systems, youll then roll up your sleeves with the Procurement Operations and partner teams to get the work done.

Create and drive a roadmap aimed at revamping our procure-to-pay system, with a focus on results and the experience of users.

Develop and monitor functional performance metrics (KPIs) and devise/deploy strategies for ongoing program optimization.

Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

What You'll Need

4+ years experience in Product Management, procurement operations/sourcing, systems management, or strategy consultancy; experience with a cloud-based P2P system is a plus.

This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies while also providing centralized leadership of key analytics functions. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts with dotted line responsibilities for 5-6 additional individuals across partner functions (Promotions, Finance, Supplier Analytics, Business Trends, Operations, Merchandising Operations).
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Specialty Retail Market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive specialty pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Analytics Agenda Setting and Leadership:

Decide the key business performance problems that need to be solved for the SRBs; Define end-to-end performance analytics roadmap, outlining the metrics and analyses needed to support strategic decision-making.
Establish functional KPIs and frameworks to facilitate progress, tracking and trade-off decision-making.
Leverage analytics and SRB business context to drive decisions while advancing a cohesive SRB strategy. Decisions include, but are not limited to, catalog curation + assortment strategy, promo strategy and event curation, supplier WSC sourcing / opportunity identification, exclusivity goals and opportunities.

Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration:

Be the voice of the SRB business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Merchant, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action.
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.

Business Performance Monitoring:

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Team Leadership:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of analysts, both directly and through dotted line relationships, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Set clear goals, provide regular feedback, and enable professional growth within the team.

Proven Experience:

10+ years of experience in pricing, finance, or a related field, with a strong track record of driving profitability and leading teams.

Analytical Expertise:

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Strategic Vision:

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Leadership Skills:

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Industry Knowledge:

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, GBQ, Excel) and desire to roll-up sleeves alongside highly technical analysts to guide, review and improve code.  
Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.

The team in the Bengaluru delivery center can work across multiple domains that drive speed and convenience for the customer and cost efficiency across the full value chain. The work we do at Wayfair means we have to move quickly, collaborating with the best and brightest engineers, creatives, product managers, data scientists, and analysts to discover, build, and scale world-class software products.
If you love to solve real business problems at scale, in a fast-paced, high growth and agile environment, this is the role for you!

Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient backend services and APIs using Java, ensuring high performance and responsiveness for millions of users.
Develop and optimize database queries, schema designs, and data models to support complex, large-scale applications.
Write thoughtful, scalable, reusable, well tested and performant frontend code using frameworks such as React and Next
Work closely with Product Managers, UX/UI Designers, and other stakeholders to define and implement technical solutions that meet business requirements.
Write clean, scalable, and well-tested code, ensuring systems are resilient, secure, and maintainable.
Stay current with industry best practices and emerging technologies in full stack development, and actively contribute to improving the architecture and development processes.
Lead and mentor junior developers, conduct code reviews, and help establish best practices in software engineering across the team.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve complex issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of the systems.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the development process, including the implementation of CI/CD pipelines and automated testing.

6+ years experience in Software Engineering with designing and building large scale platforms as a Full stack Developer with Backend heavy. 
Experience leading/supervising and/or mentoring engineers, leading code reviews, and establishing best engineering practices.
Passion for leading cross functional projects through collaboration and influencing design decisions.
Deep understanding of modern programming languages such as Java, Python, PHP, C#, Go, Scala, or similar languages.
Professional experience coding JavaScript, CSS, and HTML from scratch as well as a familiarity with modern client-side frameworks (React, Ember, Angular, Vue, Styled Components, SASS, etc)
A solid understanding of JavaScript state management libraries, such as Redux, MobX, or Apollo

Proficient in testing and debugging techniques to identify and fix issues in their code
A passion for UI, UX, and Design Systems and working with designers to create engaging and intuitive experiences across devices
Experience in working with product managers and designers to define, break down, and collaborate on feature work
A genuine believer in constructive and respectful code reviews, retros, and collaborative problem-solving as the bedrock of a healthy team
Great communication skills and the ability to support technical decision making with the team.

The Wayfair Outlet Team is redefining the way we monetize returned goods and aged inventory across the network. We are investing in physical retail Wayfair Outlet stores to sell imperfect items directly to customers. Wayfair has successfully piloted physical retail outlet stores and anticipates opening an additional 3-4 stores in 2025, and up to 50 within the next three years. 
In this role you will manage on-site project execution for new outlet launches, including schedule development, issue resolution, and stakeholder coordination. The right candidate has 3-5 years of relevant experience, strong problem-solving, time management, and organizational skills.

Ensure adherence to budgets and project processes.

Create progress update reports.

Ability to work under pressure, prioritize tasks, and maintain efficiency 
Strong organizational, project management, multitasking, and resource planning skills with attention to detail.

Proficiency in Google Suite.

Success in developing stakeholder/vendor relationships for project execution.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, judgment, and decision-making abilities.

Title: Lead, Business Performance & Strategy
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

4+ years of work experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.

Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal

Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company

Title: Senior Associate, Supplier Management
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for this position for the following work visas: F1-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
We are seeking a detail-oriented and driven individual with proven analytical skills to join our Category Management team as a Senior Category Associate. This role will be instrumental in contributing to enhanced customer satisfaction through data-driven assortment decisions. You will be responsible for driving sales growth and improving profitability, as well as identifying new business opportunities, developing internal and external relationships, and negotiating with key suppliers. Further responsibilities may include expanding the assortment and developing a competitive market strategy. You will collaborate closely with a Senior Category Manager to establish and execute product category strategies, nurture supplier relationships, drive process improvements, and negotiate pricing and inventory. We encourage applications from high-caliber professionals with transferable skills developed in generalist business settings. While an interest in style, home fashion, and decor is beneficial, we also value candidates with strong business acumen and a proven ability to apply their skills across various product categories.
Who We Are
The Category Management team at Wayfair drives strategic growth for key product categories through strong internal and external partnerships. We leverage data to optimize supplier relationships and enhance the platform experience. Our team members are strategic thinkers, effective negotiators, and skilled project managers who define category goals and execute tactical plans.
How is this opportunity unique?
This role offers opportunities to build and manage collaborative external partnerships. It's a data-driven environment where analytical skills are highly valued and used to inform strategic decisions. We provide a dynamic and evolving work environment that encourages innovation and calculated risk-taking. We foster a collaborative and engaging environment that values work-life balance and offers opportunities for continuous professional development and mentorship.
What Youll Do

Lead the development and execution of strategic category plans to achieve revenue and profitability goals.
Leverage event and category performance data to generate actionable insights and drive business adjustments.
Conduct competitive and product category analysis to evaluate market trends.
Collaborate cross-functionally to proactively identify and capitalize on assortment opportunities.
Negotiate favorable terms with suppliers, including selection, price, and quantity.
Establish and strengthen relationships with brands, partnering effectively to achieve mutual business objectives.
Conduct competitive and product category analysis to identify new designers and brands to increase and expand selection across product categories.
Collaborate with numerous cross-functional partners (Pricing, Promotions, Operations, Merchandising, and more!).

What Youll Need

4+ years of experience within an e-commerce or corporate retail organization is preferred.
A strong interest in developing a career in buying, merchandising, and/or supplier relationship management.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with business partners.
Ability to communicate effectively and comfortably with C-suite level suppliers from large companies.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously (with attention to detail).
Solid understanding of or aptitude for learning retail math concepts.
Adept at analyzing data to identify trends and inform decisions.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, take initiative, and achieve set goals effectively.
Proactive and solution-oriented approach to challenges and opportunities.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Google Suite is preferred.
A drive to achieve growth with the ability to think creatively and overcome limitations.
Demonstrated potential to work effectively as part of a cross-functional team.
Desire to develop business plans and contribute to strategic initiatives.
